data.title: The Best Dub Musicians
data.meta_description: Over 800 music fans have voted on the 150+ Best Dub Musicians. Current Top 3: King Tubby, Lee “Scratch” Perry, Scientist
data.text:
As one of the founding fathers of dub music, King Tubby's innovative approach to sound engineering truly revolutionized the landscape of electronic music. Rising to prominence in the 1960s and '70s, Tubby's distinctive sonic manipulation and envelope-pushing techniques paved the way for a new generation of artists, solidifying his reputation as a genre-defining icon. With his penchant for stripping down reggae tracks and adding layers of echo, reverb, and other effects, he effectively crafted an entirely new sound that pushed the boundaries of what electronic music could achieve. Today, King Tubby's influence is still palpable, as countless artists continue to draw inspiration from his genre-defining creations.

Rock Out To Some Of The Most Popular Songs From King Tubby

- "King Tubby's Special"

- "Zion Gate Dub"

- "Dub From the Roots"

Dive Into King Tubby's History With Some Unique Deep Cuts

- "I Trim The Barber"

- "Dub On My Mind"

Lee “Scratch” Perry's seemingly boundless creativity and ingenuity have made him an undisputed legend in the world of dub music. With a prolific career spanning more than five decades, Perry has consistently pushed the envelope, producing some of the most groundbreaking experimental electronic music in history. Often regarded as the ultimate musical alchemist, his singular talent for blending diverse styles, instrumentation, and production techniques has created a rich tapestry of sound unlike any other. From his work at the famed Black Ark studio to his collaborations with a plethora of renowned artists, Lee “Scratch” Perry's enduring presence at the forefront of electronic music has solidified his status as a true musical visionary.

Rock Out To Some Of The Most Popular Songs From Lee "Scratch" Perry

- "Roast Fish and Cornbread"

- "Disco Devil"

- "City Too Hot"

Dive Into Lee "Scratch" Perry's History With Some Unique Deep Cuts

- "Jamaican E.T."

- "Black Vest"

When it comes to pioneering producers in the realm of dub music, few can rival the impact made by Scientist, known for his innovative approach to mixing and remixing existing tracks into entirely new soundscapes. Born Hopeton Brown, this enigmatic figure rose to prominence in the late 1970s, making waves with his distinctive style and daring exploration of the outer limits of electronic music. Channeling the spirit of his mentors, King Tubby and Lee "Scratch" Perry, Scientist infused his creations with a unique blend of technological experimentation and cerebral artistry, cementing his legacy as one of the most influential forces in dub's evolution. Today, his vast discography stands as a testament to his unerring dedication to pushing the boundaries of what the genre can accomplish.

Rock Out To Some Of The Most Popular Songs From Scientist

- "Your Teeth In My Neck"

- "Every Dub Shall Scrub"

- "Steppers"

Dive Into Scientist's History With Some Unique Deep Cuts

- "Bionic Rats Dub"

- "The Mummy's Curse"

A true musical innovator, Augustus Pablo’s mesmerizing melodica skills and haunting arrangements have left an indelible mark on the world of dub music. Emerging in the 1970s, he quickly established himself as a singular talent, fusing reggae's roots with elements of electronic music to create an entirely new and captivating soundscape. By incorporating electronic elements such as echo, reverb, and phasing into his works, Pablo not only expanded the possibilities for future generations of musicians, but also solidified his reputation as a master of his craft. With his exceptional contributions to the evolution of dub and electronic music, Augustus Pablo's impact will continue to be felt for decades to come.

Rock Out To Some Of The Most Popular Songs From Augustus Pablo

- "King Tubby Meets Rockers Uptown"

- "East of the River Nile"

- "Java"

Dive Into Augustus Pablo's History With Some Unique Deep Cuts

- "Unfinished Melody"

- "Pablo's Desire"

Mad Professor, born Neil Fraser, has been a driving force in the dub music scene since the late 1970s, not only as a talented producer but also as a respected innovator of electronic music techniques. His arsenal of electronic sounds, combined with his mastery of analog equipment and recording methods, has resulted in a vast array of futuristic yet organic sonic creations that continue to inspire musicians across all genres. With a prolific discography spanning hundreds of releases, the Mad Professor consistently pushes the boundaries of dub music while remaining true to the genre's roots. His ground-breaking work in both production and remixing has cemented his status as a pivotal figure in the annals of electronic music history.

Rock Out To Some Of The Most Popular Songs From Mad Professor

- "Dub Revolution"

- "True Born African Dub"

- "Fast Forward Into Dub"

Dive Into Mad Professor's History With Some Unique Deep Cuts

- "Your Rights/My Rights"

- "Scientific Dancehall"

Spearheaded by drummer Lincoln "Style" Scott and producer Adrian Sherwood, Dub Syndicate has been crafting spellbinding electronic soundscapes for over three decades. With their unique fusion of reggae, rock, and experimental electronic sounds, this groundbreaking collective has left an indelible mark on the world of dub music. Expertly blending digital effects with classic analog techniques, Dub Syndicate consistently stays at the cutting edge of the genre, producing a rich tapestry of sound that is both captivating and immersive. Their impressive discography, which spans multiple decades, serves as a testament to their enduring appeal and influence on the global electronic music community.

Rock Out To Some Of The Most Popular Songs From Dub Syndicate

- "Ravi Shankar (Pt. 1)"

- "Empire"

- "Forever More"

Dive Into Dub Syndicate's History With Some Unique Deep Cuts

- "Red Sea"

- "Rootsman"
